meanings.sent1: The trods of the horses left marks on the muddy path.
meanings.sent2: I saw many trods in the snow, indicating a busy day at the farm.
meanings.sent3: The trods of the ducks in the pond created a funny pattern.
meanings.sent4: The trods of the dancers on the stage painted a beautiful picture.
meanings.sent5: The trods of the children on the playground were like a colorful maze.

meanings.definition: trods: third person singular present of trod
meanings.sent1: She trods lightly on the delicate flowers to avoid crushing them.
meanings.sent2: He trods carefully on the icy sidewalk to prevent slipping.
meanings.sent3: The cat trods around the house as if it owns the place.
meanings.sent4: Time trods on, never stopping for anyone or anything.
meanings.sent5: The elephant trods through the jungle, leaving a trail behind.
